thread.title: Nearly dozen ‘militants’ killed in Kurram Agency encounter
thread.title_full: Nearly dozen ‘militants’ killed in Kurram Agency encounter

author: Our Correspondent
title: Nearly dozen ‘militants’ killed in Kurram Agency encounter
text:
Share Tweet Email 
PESHAWAR: At least 11 suspected militants were killed in an encounter with security forces in Kurram Agency, one of the seven semi-autonomous regions in the country’s North West, officials said. 
Two security forces personnel were also injured during the cross-fire, security sources told The Express Tribune on Sunday. 
The suspects were reportedly travelling from neighbouring Afghanistan and entered Kurram through Khyber Agency but were intercepted by a security convoy, sources added. The bodies will be handed over to the political administration of the agency. 
The development came just two days after security forces launched a nationwide crackdown on after a bomb ripped through Lal Shahbaz Qalandar’s shrine in Sehwan, Sindh, killing over 100 militants across the country. Pakistan has seen a dramatic improvement in security in the past two years, but there have been multiple attacks this week. The assaults underscore Pakistan’s struggle to stamp out extremism, which was stepped up after the country’s deadliest ever attack, a TTP assault on Army Public School in Peshawar in 2014 which left more than 150 people dead – mostly children.
